release.action: Switched to Log4j 2.
Some deprecated classes and aspects were removed.
Java 5 will be no longer supported.
Only version updated.
ZombieAspect logs use of @Zombie classes and methods (PatternTesting Check-RT).

release.description: PatternTesting Benchmark project added for micro-benchmarking
release.action: Begin with next snapshot.
> Detection of wrong logger initialization (PatternTesting Check-RT)).
TransientTrapAspect added to find transient traps (PatternTesting Check-CT).
NotNull annotation of JSR 305 is supported.
(Abstract)ExceptionAspect added to find methods which throw an unspecific exception (PatternTesting Check-CT).
(Abstract)EncodingAspect added to find calls with undefined encoding (PatternTesting Check-CT).
Annotation SuppressStreamWarning is now deprecated and replaced by EnableStreamWarning (PatternTesting Check-CT).
Bug fixing release.
IllegalArgumentExceptionAspect added to damn the throwing of IllegalArgumentExceptions for constructors and methods which have no arguments (Check.CT).
Switched from commons-logging to SLF4J.
Suppressing "adviceDidNotMatch" warning.
Prepared for upload to https://oss.sonatype.org/
Code cleanup.
Documentation updated.
GroupId changed to "org.patterntesting".
project pages of Check.CT and Check.RT are moved to check/ct and check/rt
patterntesting-check was splitted into patterntesting-check-ct (compile time part with static checks) and pattertesting-check-rt (runtime part with dynamic checks).
DeprecatedAspect added which logs a warning if a @Deprecated method is executed.
You can mark now methods with "@OnlyForTesting". If you call these methods outside from test methods you'll get an compile error.
Methods and constructors annotated by "@PublicForTesting" are checked during runtime if they were called from a test method or from the class itself.
With the ExceptionFactory and @TestException annotation you are now able to control if a checked exception should be thrown or not.

JUnitAspect added to detect some of the JUnit anti patterns described in http://www.exubero.com/junit/antipatterns.html. Only JUnit 4 is supported so you need it in the classpath (for the used @Test annotation).
The use of System.out or System.err in main methods is now tolerated.
For performance reason the (Abstract)NullPointerTrap is limited to public methods and constructors.
Damning System.out is now the default (annotation @DamnSystemOut is no longer needed).
depencency to net.jcip removed
(Abstract)NullPointerTrap and NotNullAspect uses now the assert keyword for checking. So you can enable this checks via "java -ea ..." (for the Sun VM).
The project was splitted in several subparts: patterntesting-parent, patterntesting-rt (runtime), patterntesting-check, patterntesting-tools, patterntesting-samples.
You can mark attributes and parameters in constructors/methods as @NotNull.
See patterntesting-parent for the history.
